019package org.jgrapes.io.util;
020
021import java.io.IOException;
022import java.io.OutputStream;
023import java.nio.ByteBuffer;
024import org.jgrapes.core.EventPipeline;
025import org.jgrapes.io.IOSubchannel;
026import org.jgrapes.io.events.Close;
027import org.jgrapes.io.events.Input;
028import org.jgrapes.io.events.Output;
029
030/**
031 * An {@link OutputStream} that is backed by {@link ByteBuffer}s obtained from a
032 * queue. When a byte buffer is full, a {@link Output} event (default) is
033 * generated and a new buffer is fetched from the queue.
034 *
035 */
036public class ByteBufferOutputStream extends OutputStream {
037
038    private IOSubchannel channel;
039    private EventPipeline eventPipeline;
040    private boolean sendInputEvents;
041    private ManagedBuffer<ByteBuffer> buffer;
042    private boolean sendClose = true;
043    private boolean sendEor = true;
044    private boolean eorSent;
045    private boolean isClosed;
046
047    /**
048     * Creates a new instance that uses {@link Output} events to dispatch
049     * buffers on the given channel, using the given event pipeline.
050     * 
051     * @param channel
052     *            the channel to fire events on
053     * @param eventPipeline
054     *            the event pipeline used for firing events
055     */
056    public ByteBufferOutputStream(IOSubchannel channel,
057            EventPipeline eventPipeline) {
058        this.channel = channel;
059        this.eventPipeline = eventPipeline;
060    }
061
062    /**
063     * Creates a new instance that uses {@link Output} events to dispatch
064     * buffers on the given channel, using the channel's response pipeline.
065     * 
066     * @param channel
067     *            the channel to fire events on
068     */
069    public ByteBufferOutputStream(IOSubchannel channel) {
070        this(channel, channel.responsePipeline());
071    }
072
073    /**
074     * Causes the data to be fired as {@link Input} events rather
075     * than the usual {@link Output} events. 
076     * 
077     * @return the stream for easy chaining
078     */
079    public ByteBufferOutputStream sendInputEvents() {
080        sendInputEvents = true;
081        return this;
082    }
083
084    /**
085     * Suppresses sending of a close event when the stream is closed. 
086     * 
087     * @return the stream for easy chaining
088     */
089    public ByteBufferOutputStream suppressClose() {
090        sendClose = false;
091        return this;
092    }
093
094    /**
095     * Suppresses setting the end of record flag when the stream is 
096     * flushed or closed.
097     * 
098     * @return the stream for easy chaining
099     * @see Output#isEndOfRecord()
100     */
101    public ByteBufferOutputStream suppressEndOfRecord() {
102        sendEor = false;
103        return this;
104    }
105
106    private void ensureBufferAvailable() throws IOException {
107        if (buffer != null) {
108            return;
109        }
110        try {
111            buffer = channel.byteBufferPool().acquire();
112        } catch (InterruptedException e) {
113            throw new IOException(e);
114        }
115    }
116
117    /*
118     * (non-Javadoc)
119     * 
120     * @see java.io.OutputStream#write(int)
121     */
122    @Override
123    public void write(int data) throws IOException {
124        ensureBufferAvailable();
125        buffer.backingBuffer().put((byte) data);
126        if (!buffer.hasRemaining()) {
127            flush(false);
128        }
129    }
130
131    /*
132     * (non-Javadoc)
133     * 
134     * @see java.io.OutputStream#write(byte[], int, int)
135     */
136    @Override
137    public void write(byte[] data, int offset, int length) throws IOException {
138        while (true) {
139            ensureBufferAvailable();
140            if (buffer.remaining() > length) {
141                buffer.backingBuffer().put(data, offset, length);
142                break;
143            } else if (buffer.remaining() == length) {
144                buffer.backingBuffer().put(data, offset, length);
145                flush(false);
146                break;
147            } else {
148                int chunkSize = buffer.remaining();
149                buffer.backingBuffer().put(data, offset, chunkSize);
150                flush(false);
151                length -= chunkSize;
152                offset += chunkSize;
153            }
154        }
155    }
156
157    /**
158     * Creates and fires an {@link Output} event with the buffer being filled. 
159     * The end of record flag of the event is set according to the parameter.
160     * Frees any allocated buffer.
161     */
162    private void flush(boolean endOfRecord) throws IOException {
163        if (buffer == null) {
164            if (!endOfRecord || eorSent) {
165                return;
166            }
167            ensureBufferAvailable();
168        }
169        if (buffer.position() == 0 && (!endOfRecord || eorSent)) {
170            // Nothing to flush
171            buffer.unlockBuffer();
172        } else {
173            if (sendInputEvents) {
174                eventPipeline.fire(Input.fromSink(buffer, endOfRecord),
175                    channel);
176            } else {
177                eventPipeline.fire(Output.fromSink(buffer, endOfRecord),
178                    channel);
179            }
180            eorSent = endOfRecord;
181        }
182        buffer = null;
183    }
184
185    /**
186     * Creates and fires a {@link Output} event with the buffer being filled
187     * if it contains any data.
188     * 
189     * By default, the {@link Output} event is created with the end of record
190     * flag set (see {@link Output#isEndOfRecord()}) in order to forward the 
191     * flush as event. This implies that an {@link Output} event with no data
192     * (but the end of record flag set) may be fired. This behavior can
193     * be disabled with {@link #suppressEndOfRecord()}.
194     */
195    @Override
196    public void flush() throws IOException {
197        flush(sendEor);
198    }
199
200    /**
201     * Flushes any remaining data with the end of record flag set
202     * (unless {@link #suppressEndOfRecord()} has been called)
203     * and fires a {@link Close} event (unless {@link #suppressClose()}
204     * has been called).
205     */
206    @Override
207    public void close() throws IOException {
208        if (isClosed) {
209            return;
210        }
211        flush(sendEor);
212        if (sendClose) {
213            eventPipeline.fire(new Close(), channel);
214        }
215        isClosed = true;
216    }
217}
